summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI personnel, discussing coordination on the Epstein case regarding the review of seized electronic devices. It involves planning a call to get an update and determine which devices will be reviewed by different offices (likely the FBI and SDNY).

persons.name: Mader, R.
persons.context: Appears as the recipient or sender in the email chain, identified with FBI affiliation in New York.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Addressed in the email, appears to be coordinating with others about device review and setting up a call.

connections.description: Communicating via email about case coordination and setting up a call.
Mandy has spoken to M, who is requesting an update and coordination on device review.

events.title: Coordination on Device Review
events.description: FBI personnel discuss via email the need to coordinate a call to get an update on the review of seized electronic devices in the Epstein case, specifically regarding which devices will be assigned to different offices (FBI and SDNY).

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating the review of seized electronic devices in the Epstein case as of October 2020.
The coordination involved determining which devices would be reviewed by the FBI versus the SDNY (Southern District of New York).
The email indicates ongoing investigative work and inter-office collaboration well after Epstein's death in 2019.
